# Structure in HTML

## Today’s Focus

-   Add **structure** with semantic tags
-   Learn the page skeleton:
    -   `<header>` — title + navigation
    -   `<nav>` — menu of links
    -   `<main>` — main content
    -   `<section>` — thematic grouping
    -   `<footer>` — closing info
-   Add **internal navigation** with `id` and `href="#..."`

## Why Structure Matters

Without structure:

``` html
<h1>My Mini Site</h1>
<p>Hello world! ...</p>
<h2>Links</h2>
<p>Visit <a href="https://example.com">Example</a>.</p>
<h2>Image</h2>
<p><img src="pic.jpg" alt="..."></p>
```

## Why Structure Matters

With structure:

``` html
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8" />
  <title>My Mini Site</title>
</head>
<body>
  <h1>My Mini Site</h1>

  <p>Hi, I'm Student Name. This site will become my simple portfolio.</p>

  <h2>Education</h2>
  <p>University of Somewhere — B.A. (2025)</p>

  <h2>Projects</h2>
  <p>Project One: a short description goes here.</p>

  <h2>Contact</h2>
  <p>Email me at <a href="mailto:student@example.edu">student@example.edu</a>.</p>

  <p><img src="https://picsum.photos/300/180" alt="A random placeholder image"></p>
</body>
</html>
```

# Learning HTML Structure

## Create a New `html` File

-   Create a new .html file, call it `structure.html`.
-   Here is the starting code:

``` html
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8" />
  <title>Stinky's Cheesemonger</title>
</head>
<body>
  <h1>Stinky's Cheesemonger</h1>

  <p>Welcome to Stinky's — your neighborhood shop for gloriously pungent cheeses.</p>

  <h2>Cheeses</h2>
  <p>Try our favorites: Époisses, Limburger, Blue Stilton.</p>

  <h2>Shop Info</h2>
  <p>123 Rind Lane, Fromage City, FC</p>

  <h2>Contact</h2>
  <p>Email us at <a href="mailto:hello@stinkys.cheese">hello@stinkys.cheese</a></p>

  <p><img src="https://picsum.photos/320/200" alt="A plate of assorted cheeses"></p>
</body>
</html>
```

## The `<header>`

**Purpose:** Introduces the page (or a big section). Commonly holds the site name/logo and navigation.

**Rules of thumb** - You can have a top-level `<header>` for the page.\
- You can also have headers *inside* sections (advanced; we’ll stick to one for now).

## Add a `<header>`

``` html
<body>
 <header>
    <h1>Stinky's Cheesemonger</h1>
 </header>

...
</body>
```

## `<nav>` with links

**Purpose:** A container for site links (menus, table of contents, etc).

**Rules of thumb**

-   Put it **inside** your page `<header>`.
-   Links can be internal (jump to a section) or external.

## Add a `<nav>` with links

``` html
<body>
  <header>
    <h1>Stinky's Cheesemonger</h1>
    <nav>
      <a href="#about">About</a>
      <a href="#cheeses">Cheeses</a>
      <a href="#shop">Shop Info</a>
      <a href="#contact">Contact</a>
    </nav>
  </header>

...
</body>
```

## `<main>`

## Add `<main>`

-   Wrap your page's primary content in a `<main>...</main>` element.

``` html
<body>

...

  <main>
    <p>Welcome to Stinky's — your neighborhood shop for gloriously pungent cheeses.</p>

    <h2>Cheeses</h2>
    <p>Try our favorites: Époisses, Limburger, Blue Stilton.</p>

    <h2>Shop Info</h2>
    <p>123 Rind Lane, Fromage City, FC</p>

    <h2>Contact</h2>
    <p>Email us at <a href="mailto:hello@stinkys.cheese">hello@stinkys.cheese</a></p>

    <p><img src="https://picsum.photos/320/200" alt="A plate of assorted cheeses"></p>
  </main>
</body>
```

## `<section>`s and `id`s

## Add `<section>`s and `id`s

``` html
<body>
  <header>
    <h1>Stinky's Cheesemonger</h1>
    <nav>
      <a href="#about">About</a>
      <a href="#cheeses">Cheeses</a>
      <a href="#shop">Shop Info</a>
      <a href="#contact">Contact</a>
    </nav>
  </header>

  <main>
    <section id="about">
      <h2>About</h2>
      <p>Welcome to Stinky's — your neighborhood shop for gloriously pungent cheeses.</p>
      <p><img src="https://picsum.photos/320/200" alt="A plate of assorted cheeses"></p>
    </section>

    <section id="cheeses">
      <h2>Cheeses</h2>
      <p>Try our favorites:</p>
      <ul>
        <li>Époisses — washed-rind, famously aromatic</li>
        <li>Limburger — creamy, assertive, legendary funk</li>
        <li>Blue Stilton — crumbly, sharp, deeply savory</li>
      </ul>
    </section>

    <section id="shop">
      <h2>Shop Info</h2>
      <p>123 Rind Lane, Fromage City, FC</p>
      <p>Open Tue–Sat, 11am–6pm</p>
    </section>

    <section id="contact">
      <h2>Contact</h2>
      <p>Email us at <a href="mailto:hello@stinkys.cheese">hello@stinkys.cheese</a></p>
    </section>
  </main>
</body>
```

## The `<footer>`

## Back to top

-   You can add an anchor that takes the user back to the top, which goes right after `<body>`:

``` html
<body>
  <a id="top"></a> <!-- optional back-to-top anchor -->
```

## Add a `<footer>`

-   At the end of your site, after `</main>` but before `</body>', you can add your`

    <footer>...</footer>

    \` element

``` html
  </main>

  <footer>
    © 2025 Stinky's Cheesemonger · <a href="#top">Back to top</a>
  </footer>
</body>
```

<section id="header-discussion" class="slide level2 center">
  <h2>The <code>&lt;header&gt;</code></h2>
  <p><strong>Purpose:</strong> Introduces the page (site name/logo + nav).</p>
  <p><strong>Rules:</strong> One page-level header. Can also be used inside sections (advanced).</p>
  <pre><code class="language-html">&lt;header&gt;
  &lt;h1&gt;Stinky's Cheesemonger&lt;/h1&gt;
&lt;/header&gt;</code></pre>
</section>

<section id="nav-discussion" class="slide level2 center">
  <h2>The <code>&lt;nav&gt;</code></h2>
  <p><strong>Purpose:</strong> Holds navigation links.</p>
  <p><strong>Rules:</strong> Goes inside the header. Links can be internal or external.</p>
  <pre><code class="language-html">&lt;nav&gt;
  &lt;a href="#about"&gt;About&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;a href="#cheeses"&gt;Cheeses&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;a href="#shop"&gt;Shop Info&lt;/a&gt;
  &lt;a href="#contact"&gt;Contact&lt;/a&gt;
&lt;/nav&gt;</code></pre>
</section>

<section id="main-discussion" class="slide level2 center">
  <h2>The <code>&lt;main&gt;</code></h2>
  <p><strong>Purpose:</strong> Contains the primary page content.</p>
  <p><strong>Rules:</strong> One per page. Improves accessibility.</p>
  <pre><code class="language-html">&lt;main&gt;
  &lt;!-- Sections go here --&gt;
&lt;/main&gt;</code></pre>
</section>

<section id="section-discussion" class="slide level2 center">
  <h2>The <code>&lt;section&gt;</code></h2>
  <p><strong>Purpose:</strong> Groups related content with a heading.</p>
  <p><strong>Rules:</strong> Each section begins with an <code>&lt;h2&gt;</code>. Give each an <code>id</code>.</p>
  <pre><code class="language-html">&lt;section id="cheeses"&gt;
  &lt;h2&gt;Cheeses&lt;/h2&gt;
  &lt;ul&gt;
    &lt;li&gt;Époisses&lt;/li&gt;
    &lt;li&gt;Limburger&lt;/li&gt;
    &lt;li&gt;Blue Stilton&lt;/li&gt;
  &lt;/ul&gt;
&lt;/section&gt;</code></pre>
</section>

<section id="footer-discussion" class="slide level2 center">
  <h2>The <code>&lt;footer&gt;</code></h2>
  <p><strong>Purpose:</strong> Ends the page. Great for © YEAR, contact info, or “Back to top.”</p>
  <pre><code class="language-html">&lt;footer&gt;
  © 2025 Stinky's Cheesemonger · &lt;a href="#top"&gt;Back to top&lt;/a&gt;
&lt;/footer&gt;</code></pre>
</section>
